data.title: Derby Public Schools, USD 260
data.text:
New Directions is a no cost Employee Assistance Program (EAP) the district is providing for ALL district staff. In addition to private, licensed counseling services for personal issues, this program provides financial consultation, legal consultation, Work-Life Plus + program, and access to a critical incident crisis intervention team. New Directions has been working in behavioral health through EAPs for 35 years.

Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

Employees, their spouses and/or minor children will be granted FREE access to district events if accompanied by the employee. The employee must have their badge with them. The card is designed for use at district sponsored activities with the exception of dramatical performances, concerts, musicals, tournaments, State and/or AVCTL sponsored playoffs.

Let's connect! Derby Public Schools utilizes social media to share current news, information as well as fun photos throughout the year to provide an inside look at the daily routine of our students. If you already have found us on social media, please share and spread the word about our pages. All schools are also on Facebook and Twitter! Social media may also help serve as one of our critical lines of communication during emergencies and will be a great place for you to get up to date information.

Hashtags: #BeTheWhy #DerbyProud #GreenIsMagic #DerbyBOE #DerbyBondProgress #DerbyBack2School

Three Reasons to Follow Derby Public Schools:

Knowledge: You will stay informed on district happenings and new initiatives, get an inside look in our schools and stay engaged while we strive to achieve our vision of every student, every day, preparing for the future.

Stay Connected: Keep up to date with what is going on at your studentâ€™s school and the district as a whole. Participate in the shared experience of our social media community. Like, share, comment on topics that inspire you!

Emergency Communication: During emergencies district social media feeds may be one of our critical lines of communication with our families and community stakeholders. When we respond to a school-wide or district-wide emergency, after Skylert (our mass notification tool) one of the first lines of communication to be updated will be district social media.

The district utilizes a software called FMX for scheduling facility requests and creating maintenance requests. The software provides an ease of use for USD260 staff to submit their work order directly.

How Do I Submit a Request?

Open your internet browser or browser on your phone (Chrome, Firefox, Internet Explorer, etc.) and navigate to usd260.gofmx.com/login (or use the button below).

Click the "Log in with Google" button to log in to FMX. This will register you as a Staff member.

Begin a maintenance request clicking the orange "New Request" button in the top right corner.

Submit a maintenance Request
